reason.tex: \sqrt{9-25x^2} = \sqrt{3^2-(5x)^2}.\text{ When compared}\\ \text{with }\sqrt{a^2-t^2}, \text{it is clear that }a = 3, t = 5x.

options.tex: \begin{align} \text{Let } t &= 5x \\ \implies dt &= 5\cdot dx \implies dx = \dfrac{dt}{5} \\ \therefore \int\dfrac{dx}{\sqrt{9-25x^2}} &= \dfrac{1}{5}\int\dfrac{dt}{\sqrt{3^2-t^2}} \\ &= \dfrac{1}{5}\cdot\sin^{-1}\dfrac{t}{3} + C \\ &= \dfrac{1}{5}\cdot\sin^{-1}\dfrac{5x}{3} + C \end{align}

reason.tex: \text{Use the standard result }\int\dfrac{dt}{\sqrt{a^2-t^2}} = \sin^{-1}\dfrac{t}{a} + C \\ \text{But remember,} t = 5x\text{. And so }dx = \dfrac{dt}{5}.
